resources.name: How to add multiple role/emoji pairs to an existing message

embed.title: How to add multiple role/emoji pairs to an existing message
embed.description:
`!rr addmany` requires you to separate each emoji-role pair with a newline (Shift + Enter), like so ```!rr addmany #reactroles 1238901239812 ðŸ‘¼ pure
ðŸ’© fortnite
ðŸ˜ league of legends```
Video tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=58CQzpV01ks

resources.name: How to edit reaction roles

embed.title: How to edit reaction roles
embed.description:
**1.** Copy the ID of the message you want to edit! 
> Type `!devmode` or `!id message` in <#456625369974308866> if you need help with that!

**2.** Add/remove your reaction role to the message.
> `!rr add 4558634369974308866 :emoji: rolename`
> `!rr remove 4558634369974308866 rolename` roleID or mention works too!
 [How to bulk add reaction roles](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=58CQzpV01ks)

**3.** Edit the title and description! 
> `!rr edit 4558634369974308866 NewTitle | Your text {roles}` 
`{roles}` will sync the description with the attached reaction roles on the message!
You need to separate `Title | Description` with a vertical pipe `|`
Note that Mentions don't work in Title!
*You can skip the title by not putting text before the* `|` *character in the command.*

embed.description: The default prefixes are `?`, `!` and `@Carl-bot#1536` but you can change them as per your wish, with [commands](https://docs.carl.gg/config/prefixes/) or on the [Dashboard](https://carl.gg/).

resources.name: Approving or Denying suggestions

fields.name: __Approving a suggestion__
fields.value:
The `approve` command marks a suggestion as approved.
> **Syntax:** `!approve ID reason`
> **Example:** !approve 5 Great idea man, will add it for sure

fields.name: __Denying a suggestion__
fields.value:
The `deny` command denies a suggestion.
> **Syntax:** `!deny ID reason`
> **Example:** !deny 6 This is literally impossible due to how discord works

fields.name: __Considering a suggestion__
fields.value:
The `consider` command marks a suggestion as being considered.
> **Syntax:** `!consider ID reason`
> **Example:** !consider 4 I'm not sure if this would really add that much, but if the people want it...

fields.name: __Implementing a suggestion__
fields.value:
The `implemented` command marks a suggestion as implemented.
> **Syntax:** `!implemented ID reason`
> **Example:** !implemented 5 the command is !youtubesub

fields.name: ⠀
fields.value: What a suggestion looks like (id underlined):

embed.description: For the following commands, the suggestion ID is required, but reasons are optional. If no reason is provided, the reason will be "No reason given".
embed.title: Suggestions Documentation

resources.name: Drama Feature (defer)

embed.description: When you have your automod settings to "defer", it will send the offending message to the drama channel where you can decide what the punishment suitable is through the use of reactions. This channel should obviously not be made public.

resources.name: Mention/highlight elements in reaction roles/embed messages using IDs

embed.description:
**How do you ping/highlight things in a reaction role/embed message?**

__User:__ `<@UserID>` like `<@106429844627169280>` = <@106429844627169280>
__Role:__ `<@&RoleID>` like `<@&445066659800023050>` = <@&445066659800023050> 
__Channel:__ `<#ChannelID>` like `<#465563733981265921>` = <#465563733981265921>
__Emoji:__ `<(a):EmojiName:EmojiID>` like `<:YEET:454438716610707456>` = <:YEET:454438716610707456>
*Replace the ElementID with the ID of the element on your server.*

**How to get an element ID?**
1. Enable Developer Mode: 
> ⚙ `User Settings → Appearance ("Behavior" on Mobile) → Developer Mode`
2. Right click Method:
> Works for `Users, Roles, Channels, Messages`
3. For emojis: type the `\` character before it.
> `\YourEmojiHere`, send message and copy output

**__EASIER WAY TO GET IDs:__**
1. Import [**this custom command**](https://carl.gg/t/120698) on your server
> More info about it [here](https://discordapp.com/channels/186980582863929345/474346837352906752/678755061261926419)
2. Use it with `[p]getid <elements>`
> Replace `[p]` with your server prefix
3. Copy the bot response

resources.name: How to make an embed (step-by-step image and video)

embed.description:
Using the Embed Builder on the [Dashboard](https://carl.gg/)
I = Icon urlâ €â €â €â €â €â €â €â € â € T = Thumbnail url
Image = Image urlâ €â €â €â €â €F = Footer icon
*Image urls **MUST** be direct image links*
[Video Tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jUa6YbRC0xU)

resources.name: How to edit an advanced embed

embed.title: How to edit an advanced embed:
embed.description:
Editing complex embeds can be daunting to users unfamiliar with JSON. Follow these steps:

`1.` Use the `embedsource` command to obtain your embed's content and layout. Copy the JSON Carl-bot outputs.
`2.` Paste the JSON into the embed builder on [the dashboard](https://carl.gg/) (on the top-right where it says "Raw JSON") then click "Apply".
`3.` Make your edits in the embed builder.
`4.` Click the "Copy to clipboard" button on the right side of the builder to copy the JSON for your edited embed.
`5.` If the JSON is longer than what Discord allows you to put into the text box, paste the raw JSON into a site like [Pastebin](https://pastebin.com/).
`6.` Use the `ecembed` command to update your embed by using the JSON, or Pastebin link.
`@Carl-bot#1536 ecembed msg_id #channel_embed_is_in JSON_or_Pastebin_link`

Watch the steps (without the Pastebin link) below:

resources.name: Embed Rules (Fields and Markdown)

embed.description:
•Url fields must be or lead to an HTTP/HTTPS formatted URL.
•Image fields (Image URL, Thumbnail URL, Icon URL) must be direct image links (end in .png, .jpg, .gif etc)
•All Title fields, the (Author's) Name field, and the Footer cannot display mentions or named links, and have limited support of markdown formatting.
•If a field exists, the title and the description must both have values.
•Must have a value in "Name" for "Icon URL" to display.
•Must have a value in "Name" for "Name URL" to work.
•Must have a value in "Title" for "Title URL" to work.
•Must have a value in "Footer" for the "Footer icon" to display.
•In addition to the stated character limits for each field provided below the embed builder's text boxes, the sum of all characters in an embed structure must not exceed 6000 characters.
•Do not put values in the JSON "timestamp": field if you don't know the correct format for them. The correct format is ISO 8601: `yyyy-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.000Z`

resources.name: Hyperlinks (or named links) in Embed Messages

embed.description:
Inserting the name and URL in the following format:
`[Name goes here](URL_goes_here "mouse hover text goes in quotes")`

__Example__
`[Dashboard](https://carl.gg/ "Most dashing dashboard ever")` would look like:
[Dashboard](https://carl.gg/ "Most dashing dashboard ever")
embed.title: In Embed "Description" fields, you can create named links by

resources.name: Creating and using feeds and announce with them

fields.name: __Step 1: Creating a feed__
fields.value:
The `create` subcommand creates a feed.
> **Syntax:** `!feed create feedname role`
> **Example:** !feed create mods <@&209797471608635392>

fields.name: __Step 1.5: Moving a feed__
fields.value:
The channel the feed will be associated with is the channel in which it was created. Don't want your announcements sent in that channel? Move it with the `move` subcommand.
> **Syntax:** `!feed move feedname channel`
> **Example:** !feed move mods #staff-chat

fields.name: __Step 2: Using a feed__
fields.value:
To use the feed, you use the `announce` subcommand.
(`announce` is also an alias for `feed announce`)
> **Syntax:** `!announce feedname your message`
> **Example:** !announce mods Stop trolling the users with echo.

fields.name: __Viewing feeds:__
fields.value: You can see a list of all of the feeds on your server by using the `feed` or `feeds` command without any subcommands.

fields.name: __Deleting feeds:__
fields.value:
Say you are done with the feed and you don't need it anymore. To delete it, you use `feed delete`. This does *NOT* delete the channel or the role the feed associates.
> **Syntax:** `!feed delete feedname`
> **Example:** !feed delete mods

It's useful to [combine feeds with tags](https://discordapp.com/channels/186980582863929345/554783406890680331/629497445021253649) to give users that otherwise would not be able to use the announce command permission through `{­override­}` to make announcements to one specific role without needing to give that user the ability to create, move, or delete other feeds.

embed.description:
What are feeds? Feeds are a way for you to make announcements and ping a specific role without having to deal with the annoyances and potential abuse from having a mentionable role or manually toggling a role inbetween mentionable and not. You need Manage Server Discord permissions to use the feed commands.

A feed is an association between a role and a channel. When you use the feed announce command, the role will be set to mentionable very briefly, the role will be pinged and your message will be sent in the channel with which the feed is associated, and the role will subsequently be set back to unmentionable.
embed.title: Feed Documentation

resources.name: My autofeed message disappeared. What to do?

embed.description:
See the yellow box below? That tells Carl-bot when to ***initially*** send your Autofeed message. As the text underlined in yellow states, the date and time you select in that box __must be__ more than **60** seconds from the time you click "Create", or your Autofeed __will **not repeat**__ and __will **be deleted**__ after it sends the first time.

We **strongly** recommend selecting a time in the yellow box that is at least **5 to 10 minutes** ahead of your current time for your Autofeed to be 100% safe from deletion, provided you have set a repeat duration. 

The red box is where you set the repeat duration. The minimum repeat duration is 1 hour, and as the text underlined in red states, if you have selected a role for your Autofeed to mention, that role will not be "pinged" if the repeat duration is less than **1 day**.
embed.title: Did your Autofeed message disappear?

resources.name: How to easily setup the logging system in a single command

embed.title: really really simple
embed.description:
Make sure Carl-Bot's role has the "Manage Webhook" permission, then do:
<@!235148962103951360> log AIO
<@!235148962103951360> modlog create <name>

resources.name: How to fix your logs with `log vci`

embed.description:
Follow these steps to fix your logs:

1. Make sure **Manage Webhooks** permission is enabled on the Carl-bot role.

2. Use the command `!log vci` to create any missing webhooks.

3. Use the command `!dump` and ignore the text or file it outputs (it's just a list of all your members) this will force the bot to recache your member list. This typically resolves the issue if `!log vci` comes back without errors.

resources.name: How to Setup Channel Permissions for Mute and Lockdown

fields.name: Verified or Member role(s):
fields.value:
__`Read Messages`__ <:GreenTick:699124840879226922>
__`Send Messages`__ <:GreySlash:699124735208063047>

fields.name: Mute role:
fields.value:
__`Read Messages`__ <:GreySlash:699124735208063047>
__`Send Messages`__ <:RedTick:699124870352732251>

fields.name: @everyone role:
fields.value:
__`Read Messages`__ <:RedTick:699124870352732251>
__`Send Messages`__ <:GreySlash:699124735208063047>

fields.name: â €
fields.value:
> "I don't want non-verified users talking.
> Shouldn't I put a <:RedTick:699124870352732251> on __`Send Messages`__ for @everyone?"

No. Your non-verified users cannot talk in channels they cannot see.
Therefore, only the <:RedTick:699124870352732251> on __`Read Messages`__ is necessary. 
Furthermore, a <:GreenTick:699124840879226922> on __`Send Messages`__ for your Verified or Member roles would override the <:RedTick:699124870352732251> on __`Send Messages`__ for the Mute role, preventing the Mute role from actually muting users.

embed.title: How to Setup Channel Permissions for Mute and Lockdown:

resources.name: Make, view, remove and clear user notes

fields.name: __Making a note__
fields.value:
The `setnote` command assigns the note to the member specified.
> **Syntax:** `!setnote @member note`
> **Example:** !setnote @Carl#0001 is awesome!

fields.name: __Viewing notes__
fields.value:
The `notes` command displays all of a specified member's notes.
> **Syntax:** `!notes @member`
> **Example:** !notes @Carl#0001

fields.name: __Removing notes__
fields.value:
The `removenote` command removes a note by its note id
> **Syntax:** `!removenote note_id`
> **Example:** !removenote 6

fields.name: __Clearing a member's notes__
fields.value:
The `clearnotes` command removes all notes from a member.
> **Syntax:** `!clearnotes @member`
> **Example:** !clearnotes @Carl#0001

fields.name: ​
fields.value: What a note looks like (id is circled):

embed.description: Do **NOT** turn "Delete Invocation" on for the setnote command. The invocation is deleted by default, and turning that setting on may result in an error. All note commands require the user to have 'Manage Server' Discord server permission.

resources.name: Channel overrides are simple!

embed.description:
It follows the hierarchy <:greentick:318044721807360010> > <:redtick:318044813444251649> > <:graytick:475852819296026624> meaning that if a member has 6 overrides affecting them, with 5 of them being explicit denies and one being an explicit allow, it counts as an allow.
The order of the overrides does **__not__** matter.
__Related Videos:__
[Lengthy Talk on Overrides](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l_EqSBWuC5E)
[tl;dr Talk on Overrides](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u7roBtU6thA)
embed.title: Channel overrides are simple!

resources.name: Full Guide to Carl-bot Command Override

footer.text: ¹Provided said command is enabled, neither the command nor the bot are flagged as "Mod Only", Carlbot can see the channel it was issued in, and the command does not require Discord-specific permissions by default which must be overridden separately.

fields.name: ***In the context of Carlbot commands, there are:***
fields.value:
> 1) Roles and channels that ignore any other overrides (#2-4).
> 2) Global blacklists for both channels and roles.
> 3) Per-command blacklists for both channels and roles.
> 4) Per-command whitelists for both channels and roles.
These overrides are followed in a top-down order. 
So #1 > #2-4, #2 > #3-4, and #3 > #4.
#1 and #2 can be found in the Global Settings tab of the Commands menu on the [Dashboard](https://carl.gg/). #3 and #4 are found in specific command settings on the dashboard by clicking the gear icon for any given command.

fields.name: ***What do those mean? Here are the rules:***
fields.value:
> #1: Carlbot *will* acknowledge any command issued either by a user with a role listed as ignoring overrides, or in a channel listed as ignoring overrides.¹
> #2: Carlbot *will not* acknowledge any command issued either by a user with a role on the global blacklist, or in a channel on the global blacklist.
> #3: Carlbot *will not* acknowledge a specific command issued either by a user with a role on that command's blacklist, or in a channel on that command's blacklist.
> #4: Carlbot *will only* acknowledge a specific command when it is issued either by a user with a role on that command's whitelist, or in a channel on that command's whitelist.¹

embed.description:
> A __Blacklist__ refers to the testing of a desired input against a list of negative attributes. Inputs matching *ANY* negative attributes are ignored or excluded.
> A __Whitelist__ refers to the testing of a desired input against a list of possible correct attributes. *ONLY* inputs matching a correct attribute are accepted.
Usually whitelists and blacklists are used exclusively, not in conjunction.
embed.title: **Guide to Carlbot Command Overrides**

resources.name: Guide to Carl-bot Poll, Quickpoll and Strawpoll
Adding, viewing and using ranks

footer.text: Roles with spaces, emojis, or symbols should be surrounded with quotation marks, mentioned, or referred to by role id.

fields.name: __Authorizing roles__
fields.value:
The `addrank` command adds a role to the ranks system so it can be self-assigned. The command user must have 'Manage Roles' permission, and both the command user and the bot must be able to add the role to other users (both must be higher in the hierarchy than the target role). \**See footnote*.
> **Syntax:** `!addrank role(s)`
> **Example:** !addrank Orange Yellow Green Purple Red Cyan Pink "Seafoam Green"

fields.name: __Viewing ranks__
fields.value: The `ranks` command displays all roles that have been authorized for self-assignment.

fields.name: __Using ranks__
fields.value:
Users can add or remove ranks from themselves with the `rank` coammand:
> **Syntax:** `!rank role`
> **Example:** !rank Green
and with the `rank custom` command.
> **Syntax:** `!rank custom +RoleToAdd -RoleToRemove`
> **Example:** !rank custom +Red +Pink -Green

fields.name: __Deauthorizing roles__
fields.value:
The `removerank` command removes a role from the ranks system so it can no longer be self-assigned. The command user must have 'Manage Roles' permission, and both the command user and the bot must be able to add the role to other users (both must be higher in the hierarchy than the target role). \**See footnote*.
> **Syntax:** `!removerank role(s)`
> **Example:** !removerank Yellow "Seafoam Green" Cyan

embed.description: Ranks are roles that have been authorized by a server Admin or Moderator for self-assignment through the use of the `rank` command by users. This system is similar to `iam` commands in other bots.
embed.title: Ranks Documentation

resources.name: How to "say things" with Carl-bot (echo, embed, cembed)

fields.name: __Sending a regular message__
fields.value:
The `echo` command makes the bot say something in the specified channel with a regular message.
> **Syntax:** `!echo #channel message`
> **Example:** !echo <#186980582863929345> Hello world

fields.name: __Sending a simple embed__
fields.value:
The `embed` command creates an embed with the specified hex color in the specified channel, containing a title and/or description. Separate the title from the description with a vertical pipe `|`.
> **Syntax:** `!embed #channel #HEXCLR Title|Description`
> **Example:** !embed <#186980582863929345> #ABCDEF Hello|world

fields.name: __Sending a complex embed__
__Sending messages with the Dashboard's Embed Builder__
fields.value: The [Dashboard](https://carl.gg/)'s Embed Builder can send both regular messages and embeds to the specified channel. Accessing a server's dashboard requires having Manage Server permission in that server.

resources.name: Displaying User Demographics (youngest and oldest accounts) + dump command

fields.name: __Account Age Lists:__
fields.value:
The two commands `youngest` and `oldest` will respectively display the member accounts on a server which were created most or least recently. The count parameter is how many members to list, and can only be up to 25.
> **Syntax:** `!youngest count`
> **Syntax:** `!oldest count`
> **Example:** !youngest 10
> **Example:** !oldest 15

fields.name: __Server Age Lists:__
fields.value:
The two commands `newusers` (or `newmembers`) and `oldusers` (or `oldmembers`) will respectively display the member accounts on a server which joined that server most or least recently. The count parameter is how many members to list, and can only be up to 25.
> **Syntax:** `!newusers count`
> **Syntax:** `!oldusers count`
> **Example:** !newusers 10
> **Example:** !oldusers 15

fields.name: __Custom Lists:__
fields.value: You can use the [Dump command](https://docs.carl.gg/utilities/dump/ "Dump Documentation") to output member lists with a large amount of customization, from your choice of information, separators, enumeration and date formatting, and custom limits. It can also be specified for certain roles, combinations of roles, or members without roles. Click on the link to for instructions.

embed.description: Due to the size of the messages these commands output, they all require Manage Messages permission to be used in a server.
embed.title: Displaying User Demographics

resources.name: Get a role when joining a voice channel!

embed.description:
Join Linked Voice Channel → Gain Linked Role
Leave Linked Voice Channel → Lose Linked Role
Useful for music command channels being hidden until the user is in the music voice room, giving voice channels a linked text channel for no-mic users, and more.

Configure on your server's [Dashboard](https://carl.gg/).
embed.title: Voice Links: (Premium Only)

resources.name: Warn a member or list, remove or clear their warnings

fields.name: __Warning a member__
fields.value:
The `warn` command warns a member with an optional reason argument.
> **Syntax:** `!warn <member> [reason]`
> **Example:** !warn @Carl#0001 do not spam reactions

fields.name: __Listing warns__
fields.value:
The `warns` command lists all current warnings in the server. Specify a member to see all of their warnings.
> **Syntax:** `!warns [member]`
> **Example:** !warns @Carl#0001

fields.name: __Removing a warning__
fields.value:
The `removewarn` command removes a single warning. Specify which using the case id.
> **Syntax:** `![removewarn|removewarning] <case_id>`
> **Example:** !removewarn 17

fields.name: __Clearing all warnings from a member__
fields.value:
The `clearwarn` command removes all warnings from a member.
> **Syntax:** `![clearwarn|clearwarnings] <member>`
> **Example:** !clearwarn @Carl#0001

fields.name: ​
fields.value: What a warning looks like in modlogs (case_id underlined):

embed.description: For the following commands, `|` indicates a command alias, `< >` indicates a necessary argument, `[ ]` indicates an optional argument. Do not include any of those symbols in the invocation.
embed.title: Moderation Documentation

resources.name: What is Starboard?

embed.description:
It's like democratic pins. After you make a Starboard channel, users can react to a message with a ⭐ to 'vote' to display that post on the starboard. Once the message gets enough ⭐ reactions, Carlbot posts it onto the starboard. By default, a user's ⭐ reaction on their own post doesn't count.

Example Starboard: <#465204808861745152>
[CLICK HERE FOR THE WIKI PAGE](https://docs.carl.gg/utilities/starboard/)
embed.title: What is Starboard?

resources.name: Issues with Starboard? Answer these questions!

embed.description:
**Issues with Starboard? Answer these questions!**
â€¢ Have you tried using the dashboard instead?
â€¢ Are you reacting to the message with your own star?
â€¢ What star are you using to react with it?
â€¢ Does the bot have posting permissions in the starboard channel and viewing permissions in the channel the message is originally from?
â€¢ How many stars are being put onto the message that are NOT your own?

resources.name: Music Issue (Broken)

embed.description:
If you notice the music feature is not working as intended, it is because YouTube has been rate limiting Discord bots, including Carl-bot.

An improvement is being worked on, but since it's more on YouTube's end, don't expect too much soon.
In the meantime, using Music-dedicated bots might be the solution, as they have more resources to do a workaround and keep better uptime with that specific feature.

Stay tuned for eventual information about it. You can assign the ``announce`` role to yourself in <#445066482502729728> to get pinged for new bot announcements, and/or follow the <#443204795910848512> channel directly in your server.
embed.title: Music Issue
